subject: Programming
title: Comments Should Explain Why Not What
description: One-minute skill: Comments Should Explain Why Not What.

hook.text: A comment that says 'increment counter by one' above 'counter += 1' adds zero value.

buildup.text: Comments that restate what the code does are noise. The code already says what it does.

discovery.text: Useful comments explain why â€” the business reason, the regulatory constraint, the workaround.

twist.text: Comments rot. Code changes but comments often don't, creating lies that mislead future readers.

climax.text: The best code needs almost no comments because the names and structure explain everything.

punchline.text: If you need a comment, the code isn't clear enough.

quiz.question: What should good comments explain?
options: Why the code exists, not what it does
